text: Ship’ s Mage By: Gryphon Games     Ship’s Mage GOOD CAPTAIN WORRIES ABOUT THE DANGER OF A storm running them aground, or a kraken running one or two tree trunk-thick tentacles from starboard to port. But a great captain is at ease, knowing that he has a ship’s mage onboard. Specially trained wizards, ship’s mages master spells which keep a vessel and its crew in ship- shape. This includes preventing and repairing damage to the vessel, calming dangerous weather, and providing arcane firepower in naval engagements. Wizards who specialize in abjuration, evocation, or transmutation are the most common recruits for ship’s mages. Good-aligned ship’s mages might serve aboard merchant ships or warships for good and just rulers, while evil-aligned mages offer their support to the navies of tyrants or aboard the ships of murderous pirates. Recluses at Sea. Ship’s mages often share their landlubber counterparts’ preference for solitude. Unfortunately, such solitude is a rare commodity in the tight confines of a ship, and many ship’s mages demand their own private cabin as part of their agreement to sail. In these cabins, they keep their spellbooks (locked away and warded against water damage), spell components, and charts that help them track their proximity to magical ley lines running along the ocean floor.
